text: my name is andy boudreau
i'm from andover massachusetts as
opposed to my undergrad experience which
was really about
getting a technical education and
learning proficiency in certain fields
the hbs experience while it has that
is a lot more about meeting people and
building a professional network
to be put in a situation where every day
you're interacting with
90 people who have a diverse set of
backgrounds
but have advice or experiences that
still come back and help you with what
your goals are
is unbelievable
the best thing about the field course is
it gives us
a very low pressure and low risk
arena in which to try some
entrepreneurial ideas
we got a small amount of funding we got
put in teams
and we were told go start a company
you have to move so quickly to get
something
up and running to take advantage of an
opportunity that you see
and i have found that to be incredibly
valuable
a lot of the learning that gets done
gets done outside the classroom
when you're just chatting with people
and sharing your experiences sharing
your goals
those are the things that i think make
the https experience what it is
regardless of what your background is i
think you can come to hbs
you can contribute you can learn from
other people and you can thrive
so there isn't a person in the world
that i wouldn't recommend hbs to
you
